column1: Montcada i Reixac (Catalan pronunciation: [muŋˈkaðə j rəˈʃak])
column2: often referred to as simply Montcada
column3: is a municipality in the comarca of the Vallès Occidental in Catalonia
column4: Spain. It is situated at the confluence of the Ripoll river and the Besós river
column5: and very close to the northernmost neighbourhoods of the city of Barcelona and is therefore a part of the metropolitan area of Barcelona. It had 33

column1: The following areas make up the urban tissue of Montcada: Can Cuiàs
column11: Terra Nostra (Santa Maria de Montcada) i Vallençana-Reixac. The municipality includes a small exclave to the north between Palau-solità i Plegamans and Mollet del Vallès.
